column2: I would rather work for any company than waste another year.

column2: I'll see to it that you have a raise after the first year.
column4: 我保證你一年之後就會加人工。

column2: Do you think you can live on a dollar a day in America?

column2: Anyone over eighteen years of age counts as an adult.
column4: 所有十八歲以上嘅人都算係大人。

column2: Ten years have gone by.
Don't call me up after ten o'clock.
column4: 十點之後唔好打電話俾我。

column2: It's ten o'clock sharp.
What is on Channel 10?
column4: 第十台喺度播緊啲咩呀？

column2: Subtract two from ten and you have eight.

Is he coming? "No, I think not."
column4: 「佢嚟唔嚟㗎？」「唔，我諗佢唔嚟喇。」

column2: Is he by the car? "No, he is in the car."
column4: 「佢係咪喺架車隔籬？」「唔係。佢係喺架車入面。」

column2: Do you mind opening the window? "Not at all."
column4: 「你可唔可以幫手開一開窗呀？」「梗係可以啦。」

column2: Next time, he said.

column2: Would you mind me smoking? "Certainly not."
column4: 「你介唔介意我食煙呀？」「唔介意。」

column4: 個老師話：「好喇，我哋而家開始上堂喇。大家唔該揭開你哋書嘅第一百五十六頁。」

column2: Whose chair is this? "It is mine."

column4: 佢口震震噉講：「嗰座城堡有鬼㗎。」

column2: Are you students? "Yes, we are."

column4: 「你幾點鐘起身㗎？」「我八點鐘起身。」

column2: The sign '&' stands for 'and'.
The soup is terribly hot.

column4: 我阿哥好鍾意睇恐怖片。

column2: My brother was so absorbed in reading that he did not notice me when I entered the room.
column4: 我阿哥睇書睇到出晒神，我入咗間房度佢都唔知。

column2: Let's leave the decision to our teacher.
column4: 我哋都係等老師話事啦。

column2: I'm so embarrassed I could dig a hole and crawl into it.

Nothing is more valuable than good health.

column4: 嚴格啲講，呢套理論唔可以話係啱。

column2: Strictly speaking, the tomato is not a vegetable. It's a fruit.
column4: 嚴格嚟講，蕃茄唔係蔬菜，係生果。

column2: Judging from the present look of the sky, we may have a downpour any moment.
column4: 而家個天咁嘅款，睇落好似隨時會落大雨咁喎。

column2: People are more educated now than they used to be.
column4: 而家啲人啲教育程度高過以前好多。

column2: I wish I could see the ancient world.
column4: 我真係好想睇吓古代嘅世界係點嘅樣。

column2: I asked her to call me at five o'clock.
column4: 我叫佢五點打電話俾我。

column2: I don't want to go outside this afternoon.

column4: 唔該你閂咗你後面嗰道門佢吖。

column2: Bring the water to a boil.

What do you say to taking a walk in the park?
Don't speak with your mouth full!
column4: 唔好一路食嘢一路講嘢！

column2: The man reading a book over there is my father.
column4: 喺嗰度睇緊書嗰個就係我阿爸喇。

column2: You may come whenever you like.
column4: 你鍾意幾時嚟就幾時嚟啦。

column2: You shouldn't be so picky about food.

column4: 諗諗吓我好似約咗佢五點見面喎。

column2: Hong Kong is referred to as the Pearl of Asia.
column4: 香港俾人叫做東方之珠。

column2: I used to keep a diary when I was at high school.
column4: 我讀中學嗰陣時有寫日記㗎。

column2: I'm busy now.

column4: 如果而家停電，會發生啲咩事呢？

column2: Did you feel the earth shake just now?
column4: 你覺唔覺啱啱個地喺度震呀？

column2: I wanna quit my job.
He'll be a good husband.
I take back what I said.
column4: 我收返我頭先講過嘅嘢。

column2: What are you learning at school?
If I had eaten breakfast this morning, I would not be hungry now.
column4: 如果我今朝食咗早餐，而家就唔使咁肚餓啦。

column2: Did you have breakfast this morning?
He got up an hour early this morning.
column4: 佢今朝早咗一個鐘起身。

column2: When did you get up this morning?
I didn't have breakfast this morning.
Did you practice the piano this morning?

column4: 你可唔可以用呢條我啱啱釣到嘅魚嚟整魚生呀？

column2: Now it's your serve.

column4: 而家差唔多每家每戶都有一兩部電視喇。

column2: I put in a good word for my friend at today's meeting.
column4: 我喺今日個會度幫我個朋友講咗啲好說話。

column2: Today's paper contains nothing of importance.
column4: 今日份報紙無咩值得睇嘅新聞。

column2: Today's weather forecast says that it is likely to be fine tomorrow.
column4: 今日個天氣報告話聽日應該會好天。

column2: It is likely to rain today.

column4: 我今日想出街，唔想留喺屋企。

column2: Aren't you supposed to be at school today?
There is no school today.
It's cold today.
Let's let the workers go home early today.
column4: 我哋今日俾班伙記早啲返屋企啦。

column2: It's hot today.
It's rather cold today.
As I am off duty today, let's go to the beach.
column4: 我今日唔使當值呀，不如一齊去沙灘玩吖。

column2: Can I borrow your tennis racket today?
column4: 今日可唔可以借你個網球拍嚟用呀？

column2: How about having a drink after we finish our work today?
column4: 我哋今日做完嘢不如去飲返杯囉？

column2: Are you free tonight?
I would rather read a book at home than go out tonight.
column4: 我今晚想喺屋企睇書，唔想出街。

column2: I'll ring you up at seven this evening.
column4: 我今晚七點打電話俾你吖。

column2: What shall we eat tonight?

column4: 佢同我講話：「今晚不如出去食吖。」

column2: I don't have to study tonight. I think I'll watch television for a while.
column4: 我今晚唔使溫書。我諗我會睇陣電視。

column2: Kiss the fifth man from the left.
Take the weight off your feet.
These days the number of women who don't want to change their family names even after they get married is increasing.
column4: 呢排愈嚟愈多女人結咗婚都唔想改姓。

column2: I've got little time for reading these days.
A man whose wife is dead is called a widower.
column4: 死咗老婆嘅人叫做鰥夫。

column2: Can you recommend any vegetarian dishes?
column4: 可唔可以介紹幾味齋菜呀？

column2: It occurred to me that I had left my purse at home.
column4: 我突然間醒起個銀包漏咗喺屋企。

column2: Yesterday I was on my way home from work when I ran smack into my old girlfriend.
column4: 我尋日放工返屋企嗰陣同我個舊女朋友撞到正。

column2: I didn't get much sleep last night so I was nodding off all day at work.
column4: 我尋晚冇乜點瞓過，所以今日成日返工都喺度瞌眼瞓。

column2: Yesterday a truck hit this wall.
column4: 尋日有架貨車撞咗埋呢埲牆度。

column2: How did Barbara do on her driver's test yesterday?
column4: 阿 Barbara 尋日考車考成點呀？

column2: I was watching TV at this time yesterday.
column4: 我尋日呢個時間喺度睇緊電視。

column2: I learned English words by heart all day yesterday.
column4: 我尋日成日都喺度背英文字。

column2: Yesterday was my birthday.

column4: 我尋日去咗髮型屋剪頭髮。

column2: Did you call him up yesterday?
column4: 你尋日有無打電話俾佢？

column2: You should have come yesterday.

column2: Did you watch TV last night?

column4: 尋晚我冇刷牙就走咗去瞓覺。

If you need an umbrella I'll lend you one.
column4: 如果你要遮嘅話我就借把俾你啦。

column2: You'd better take an umbrella.

column4: 我哋諗住去行山，你一唔一齊呀？

column2: You can get a fine view of the sea from the mountaintop.
column4: 喺山頂度可以睇到好靚嘅海景。

column4: 山田老師每日都俾好多功課我哋做。

column4: 山田老師係教物理定化學㗎？

column2: The work over, we went home.
column4: 我哋做完嘢就返咗屋企。

column2: Busy with my work, I had no time to write to you.
column4: 我做嘢好忙，所以冇時間寫信俾你。

column4: 我哋放工不如去飲返杯囉？

column2: Do you have an extra shelf I can use?

column2: I asked Mother to wake me up at four.
column4: 我叫阿媽四點嗌我起身。

column2: My sister made me a beautiful doll.
column4: 我家姐整咗個好靚嘅公仔俾我。

column2: My sister made me a beautiful doll.
column4: 我阿妹整咗個好靚嘅公仔俾我。

column2: The boy fell off the bed.
column4: 個細路喺張床度跌咗落嚟。

column2: If you'll keep an eye on the kids, I'll take your suit to be cleaned.

column2: The child missed his mother very much.

column4: 啲細路嘈到我溫唔到書。

column2: The children are learning to add and subtract.
column4: 班小朋友喺度學緊加數同減數。

column2: It's because I was asked to come that I'm here.

column4: 我想做東，你就要我做西。

column4: 你可唔可以睇吓我封信，有咩錯嘅地方就幫我改咗佢呀？

column2: I know nothing except that she left last week.
column4: 我淨係知道佢上個禮拜走咗。

column2: Please don't interrupt me while I'm talking.

column4: 我哋一去到個月台度，班火車就開走咗。

column2: We have lots of things to do.

column4: 多謝你借本書俾我哋喎。

column2: Our school encourages sports.

column2: Our school has ten classes.

column4: 我哋一日至少要瞓七個鐘。

column2: We have two dogs, three cats, and six chickens.
column4: 我哋養咗兩隻狗，三隻貓同埋六隻雞。

column4: 我哋將道門油咗做綠色。

column2: Not only did we go to Paris, but we also visited Rome.

column2: We have a cat and a dog.

column2: My camera was stolen.

column4: 我嗰班嗰啲女仔全部都好好人。

column2: Keep your hands off my typewriter.

column2: Come along after me.

column2: My watch loses three minutes a day.

column2: My car is large enough to carry five people.
Call me up whenever you need my help.

column2: My goal in life is to be a novelist.

column2: My father is always busy.

column2: My father is so old that he is hard of hearing.

column4: 我阿爸係三年前過生嘅，啫係一九七七年。

column2: My mother has good handwriting.

column2: Where's my book?

column4: 我有啲朋友講英文講得好好。

column2: Did anyone call me while I was out?

column2: I saw him go out of the room just now.

column2: I wrote a letter to my mother.

column2: I have lived here for thirty years.

column2: I never have an ice cream without feeling happy.

column2: I don't care for green tea.

column2: I've worn out the shoes.

column4: 跟住我就攞住本書走咗出去散步。

column4: 本書係喺英國訂返返嚟㗎。

column2: I must give back the book to him by tomorrow.
column4: 我一定要喺聽日之前還返本書俾佢。

We do our best to imitate Jesus Christ and are proud to be called Christians. Each of us regularly spends time helping people learn about the Bible and God’s Kingdom.
